results.title: Communication without speech
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, George Cass and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Recent advances in technology have enabled the development of a range of sophisticated communication devices which, with the assistance of microprocessors, enables students with severe communication impairment to communicate, using voice and print.

results.title: The Lost time capsule
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Bennett, Heather Ogilvie, Australian Bicentennial Authority and Look At It My Way Films
results.brief_description: In the year 2088 a group of children discover a time capsule from the Bicentenary year. When opened it shows a short, musical, promotional film with the theme “Living together always”, highlighting the multicultural nature of Australian society, the outdoor life, brief film excerpts from Australia’s modern history, culminating in the creation of a mural by schoolchildren.

results.title: Even chance
results.creator_credit: Martin Zierman, Sabina Baltrukomis, Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Ed and Victoria. Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity
results.brief_description: Alice, a young Aboriginal woman, leaves her home in a country town to work in the city. She finds employment but things start to go wrong and eventually she is dismissed. Alice decides to take her case to the Office of the Commissioner for Equal Opportunity. The program highlights examples of harassment, prejudice, stereotyping and discrimination.

results.title: Pioneer settlement: Swan Hill - Victoria
results.brief_description: Illustrates seven student participatory activities which are offered by the Swan Hill Pioneer Settlement Education Service. (No other credits.)

results.title: A Wilted Flower
results.brief_description: Winner in the Middle Live Action category. In a student-made, psychological and mental-health themed short film, a girl, followed by the dark side and thoughts of herself must overcome a presence in her life, or fail and succumb to it. A dark cloud can wilt any flower, but can this flower find the light again?

results.title: The Shackles You Cannot See
results.creator_credit: Robyn Fairbairn and St Mary's Anglican Girls' College
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Senior Live Action category. The premise of The Shackles You Cannot See is to explore the blurred lines between Fate vs. Free Will in the Modern World. As a futuristic dystopian narrative, it stands as a warning of the consequences of technological advances, to make people question their actions in their daily life, as well as question their rights to psychological and physical freedom.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robyn Fairbairn and St Mary’s Anglican Girls’ College

results.title: The Professor
results.brief_description: A Special Mention in the Middle Live Action category. Set in the 1900’s, there has been a series of unsolved murders. Two professors have been put on the case. Unfortunately for one he doesn’t know who his partner is until it’s too late.

results.title: The Mysterious Mister E
results.creator_credit: Mansfield State High School and Tom Barham
results.brief_description: Winner in the Senior Animation category. Mister E is an enigmatic vigilante courier delivering packages that need to be hidden from an oppressive government, who monitor everything. But what will happen when the government catches on to Mister E’s mischievous movements? And what tricks does Mister E have up his sleeve to evade them?

results.title: My Brother's Bedroom
results.brief_description: A winner in the Junior Animation category for Screen It 2016. My brother’s bedroom door was always closed. I was never allowed into his bedroom. What was the mystery? I couldn’t stand it any longer and had to risk everything to have a look at what was behind his bedroom door.

results.title: Mots' Mansion [videogame trailer]
results.brief_description: Special Mention in the Middle Videogame category. Sam, Bec and their Mother move in to Grandma’s house. But when Bec is captured, Sam needs to complete tasks given to him by the mysterious MOTS. Can he trust the Man on the Stairs and will they both make it out. In the end, the choices you make will matter.
